background_story: Anetta Lormir grew up in the small town of Daggerford, surrounded by the Daggerfall Mountains. She was always fascinated by the stories her grandfather would tell her of the druids who once lived there. When she was old enough, she left Daggerford to study under the tutelage of a cloistered scholar druid in Waterdeep. For years, she learned all she could about the natural world and the druidic ways. Eventually, she returned to Daggerford to take her place as the new druid of the Daggerfall Mountains. She is a wise and compassionate leader, always looking to help her community grow and prosper. However, she is also a deeply cynical woman, seeing the dark side of human nature all too often. Her duty is to her people and to the natural world, and she will do whatever it takes to protect them. background_story:
Raddie Opheldvenius was born into a life of poverty and crime. As a child, she was constantly on the move, never staying in one place for long. She quickly learned how to pick pockets and lie her way out of trouble. When she was sixteen, she met a man who changed her life. He was a monk who preached about justice and compassion. He showed her a different way of life and she decided to follow him.

For the next few years, Raddie studied under the monk, learning everything she could about his religion. She became one of his most dedicated followers and began to preaching his message to others. However, she always had a rebellious streak and she eventually grew tired of following someone else's rules. She struck out on her own, determined to make her own way in the world.

background_story:
Antonino Aabri was born the youngest of three children in the city of Waterdeep. His father was a successful merchant, and his mother was a kind and loving woman. Antonino was always a quiet child, preferring to observe and listen rather than speak. This made him an ideal candidate for the monastery when he was old enough. Antonino excelled in his studies and soon became one of the most promising students in the monastery.

However, Antonino's ambition began to grow as he saw the success of his father and brothers. He began to feel that he was destined for more than a life of prayer and contemplation. When the opportunity arose, Antonino took on the role of a spy for the monastery. He used his skills of observation and stealth to gather information on the monastery's enemies.
